bike_trailer1.description: One adult, two kids, four wheels.   The bike trailer has been Felix's private domain... until now.
bike_trailer1.title: Bike Trailer 1

bike_trailer2.description: Milo loved it.  Felix kept saying, "Milo doesn't like it."
bike_trailer2.title: Bike Trailer 2

legos.description: The pictures attached to this Lego castle are of various types of termite traps, drawn by Dean as directed by Felix.   Felix reasoned that even the most famished termite would pause to read them, see what the princess had in store for them, and leave posthaste.
legos.title: Legos

pasta_fingers.description: Pasta gloves are all the rage in California.  We hear Brad Pitt wears them too.
pasta_fingers.title: Pasta Fingers

robots.description: Who needs a burglar alarm when the house is patrolled by space robots?
robots.title: Robots

storytime.description: The Giraffe, the Pelly, and Me is a fine book for all ages by Roald Dahl. We highly recommend it.
storytime.title: Storytime

tyedie1.description:
How much more Berkeley can you get than a tie dye party? This one was at Phoebe's, to celebrate her successful heart surgery.

Cindee Madison (with apron) is the Tie Dye Meister
tyedie1.title: Tyedie 1

tyedie2.description: Chris Burns, Cindee's husband and faithful assistant, instucts the young guests on how to properly tie before you dye.
tyedie2.title: Tyedie 2

tyedie4.description:
All this crafty business makes you hungry.

Milo ate an astronomical amount of watermelon, and Felix a no less impressive amount of chocolate cake. To each his own.
tyedie4.title: Tyedie 4

tyedie5.description: For a long time now, Phoebe has been saying that she will be a doctor when she grows up. At her party, she decided to test her vocation on Felix. 3 or 4 other kids played assistant doctors and nurses; while Felix stoically endured the most bizarre treatments.
tyedie5.title: Tyedie 5

description:
False alarm: Milo did not have chicken pox after all. It was a viral rash from another, more benign virus. All the spots disappeared after a couple of days, and they were never itchy.

Milo has a good memory. This week, he went to the Little Farm in Tilden Park with Lucie. He had gone there a month ago. After happily feeding celery to all the animals, Milo went "Duh??" and touched his nose... that's baby sign for "where's the pig?" And he was right: there had been a pig last month, but it was missing this time.

It's very sweet: Milo loves to give kisses. He kisses his stuffed animals often, and real animals as well, when he gets a chance. He kisses pictures of babies and animals in books. Whenever he plays a little rough and you tell him to be gentle; he stops, and switches to hugs and kisses.

Latest language development:

  • no: no. That's not a new word, but now he says it all the time.
  • no: yes. I warned you: he says it all the time. The intonation is slightly different when he actually means yes
  • mommy: His "mama" has evolved to a "mommy". He learned it from Felix ; Dean says "mom" and Lucie says "maman". You can tell who he really pays attention to in our house.
  • Po: His favorite teletubby.
  • dodo: sleepy.
  • [touch nose]: pig.
title: October 16
